skills.skill: Graduate of a 2-4 year state approved and/or accredited School of Nursing

duties_responsibilities.duty: Provide care for patients in a fast-paced adult surgical unit, including those with multiple co-morbidities, complex wounds and dressings, central lines, TPN, PCA’s and more.
Deliver high quality pre and post-surgical care to patients, including those undergoing general surgery, colorectal/urology, and trauma cases.
Collaborate with physician partners and demonstrate nursing excellence and outstanding teamwork.
Demonstrate critical thinking and excellent interpersonal and organizational skills to provide exceptional care to surgical patients.
Ensure compliance with Nursing Policy and Procedures and clinic specific competencies in delivering patient care.

education_certification.credential:
Graduate of a 2-4 year state approved and/or accredited School of Nursing 
BSN preferred
At least 1 year of previous of Nursing experience in acute care or sub-acute setting required
Current Massachusetts registered Nurse license required
Current American Heart Association Healthcare Provider BLS certification required
Demonstrate critical thinking, service excellence and good interpersonal communication skills, ability to read/comprehend written instructions, ability to follow verbal instructions, PC skills
Lifting 75 lbs. maximum with frequent lifting and/or carrying of objects weighing up to 25 lbs
